thread.title: Rockford gets Northwoods League baseball team
thread.title_full: Rockford gets Northwoods League baseball team

author: Derek Bayne
title: Rockford gets Northwoods League baseball team
text:
Rockford gets Northwoods League baseball team Posted: dbayne@wrex.com ROCKFORD (WREX) - 
The Northwoods League is expanding to Rockford with a team set to debut in 2016. It's a wood bat summer league for college players trying to improve during the offseason. 
Players such as Chris Sale, Max Scherzer and Curtis Granderson have played in the Northwoods League. 
The Rockford Aviators of the Frontier League folded, leaving the stadium in Loves Park open for use. The Northwoods League team, which has yet to be named, signed a five-year lease with Gurnee-based Northside Bank, the owner of the ballpark. 
The team will play a 72-game schedule from late May until early August. Can't Find Something? 10322 Auburn Road, Rockford, IL 61103 Switchboard: 815-335-2213
